bibl.title: Joseph Bowers v. William Cochrane. Petition for Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Third Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding terms at Seattle

body.p: In the District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding terms at Seattle.
In the matter of the application of Joseph Bowers for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
To the Judge of said Court
The petition of Josheph Bowers respectfully shows:

I That your petitioner is unlawfully imprisoned, detained and restrained of his liberty by William Cochrane, Sheriff of King County, Washington Territory, in the County Jail of said County, at the City of Seattle

II That the cause or pretense of said imprisonment, detention and restraint according to the best knowledge and belief of your petitioner is that the said William Cochrane holds your petitioner by virtue of an alleged commitment issued by one N. Soderberg a Justice of the Peace, in and for said County committing
your petitioner to the county jail of said county upon a charge of assaulted battery

III That the said imprisonment, detention and restraint are illegal and the illegality thereof consists in this to wit: I that on the 1st day of Nov. 1887, your petitioner has brought before said Justice of the peace, N Sodenberg, charged with committing an assault and battery in said King County; that there after on the 2nd day of Nov 1887 the said Justice adjudged your petitioner guilty of said charge crime and sentenced him to pay a fine of one thousand dollars and costs, and to be committed to the jail of said County for the period of five hundred days if said fine and costs were not paid. II That the said Justice had no jurisdiction to enter such judgement against your petitoner. III That the said Justice exceeded his jurisdiction in enterering said judgement. IV That the said alleged judgement is void

Wherefore your petitioner prays that a Writ of habeas corpus be issued herein, directed to the Sheriff of said county commanding said Sheriff to produce the body of your petitioner before your honor at a time and place therein to be named, together with said Writ, and the cause of the detetion petitioner
Territory of Washington County of King
Jos. Bowers, being first duly sworn on oath says that he is the petitioner herein; that he has heard the foregoing petition and knows the contents thereof and believes the the cause to be true
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 27th day of Nov.1887
In the matter of the application of Joseph Bowers for Habeas Corpus
